content: The National Service Scheme (NSS) unit was inaugurated in the College on 16th January 2004. Dr. R. K.Manoharan, Former NSS Coordinator, Bharathiar University, Coimbatore inaugurated the unit. Mr. P. Lakshmana Kumar, Associate Professor in the Automobile Engineering Department is the Programme Officer. Myleripalayam, a nearby village was adopted by the unit for serving to the society. Totally 4 Special camps had been conducted in the village. After that, Thoppampalayam village was adopted to conduct the Special camp and 3 special camps were conducted in the village. From 2013 onwards, Samathuvapuram near Chettipalayam has been adopted for conducting special camp. From 2017 onwards, Peedampalli village near Sulur was selected for organizing Special camp.
Our NSS team mainly focuses on the welfare of tribal people at Nilgiris. Many activities are carried out every month for them.

content.title: It is kept open for 12 hours (8.00 am to 8.00 pm) with Internet browsing facility for all its users.

text: The library is well furnished with modern facilities and resources in the form of CD / DVD – ROMs, Online Databases, Micro Documents, Books, Journals, Project Reports, Back Volume of Journals, and Video Lessons from NPTEL. The library is using an integrated library management software package (LMS) with all modules for automated library operation and Bar code system. The books are arranged and classified according to the Dewey Decimal Classification Scheme. All students and staff are members of the library and Open Access System is followed in the library.

Library is accommodated in two floors. In the Ground Floor Books for Lending and Reading room are made available. In the First Floor Reference, Rare and costly Books, Books for Higher Education, Journals, Magazines, Back Volume of Journals, Student Projects and Non Book Material (CD’s / DVD’s / Audio Video Lessons) are stacked and also the Digital Library is situated. The Library is also offering a number of information services to its users with professionally qualified staff using the printed and electronic resources and equipments.
